Params: {1: 'The Moonâ€”the closest celestial body to the earth.', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory210.png', 6: '1'}

{1: 'Back when humans were still unfamiliar with the world, the Moon channeled all their wildest stories of the night.', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory210.png', 6: '1'}
{1: 'Some people thought it was the home of gods who observed humans from afar.', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory210.png', 6: '1'}
{1: 'Times changed, but the clarity of the moonlight was unchanging.', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory210.png', 6: '1'}
{1: 'It was not until the first human footprint was left on the Moon...', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory210.png', 6: '1'}

{1: "...did the age of stories and myths end for the silver night sky, declaring the beginning of humanity's golden age.", 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory210.png', 6: '1', 9: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory232.png'}
{1: 'DialogEnable'}
{3: 'It has been a week since Karenina and Teddy accepted the job and arrived at the lunar base. After completing the Omega Prototype, Karenina began work on a new project.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Teddy', 3: 'M.I.N.D. compatibility test complete. Frame stability rate... Hey, try to move your right hand.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: 'Like this...?'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: "Yep. All good. The readings on the base stats of this frame have all exceeded a regular frame's... Just what kind of tech did that guy use in the base model he provided...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: 'Hey, missy, can I get out now?'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: 'One second... I need to read and record a disclaimer.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: 'A what now?'}

{2: 'Teddy', 3: 'A disclaimer that says I was forced to help you calibrate your frame, and I am in no way responsible if your frame explodes. The Cosmos Technicians Union cannot hold me accountable if you are killed in the line of duty.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Brashly, Karenina pulls off the cables on her body and jumps up, stretching her limbs and moving her joints.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Karenina', 3: 'Hmph, the frame is indeed performing nicely... Mobility, explosiveness, balance... all better than what I requested!', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Teddy', 3: "They modified the frame based on your requests, didn't they? Why are you surprised...", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: 'I designed the changes, but the creep provided the base model of the frame. That is why we can complete it so quickly.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: 'Are we sure... about that creep and the people in the lunar base?', 4: '2'}
{3: 'Although she has followed Karenina to the Moon, Teddy clearly distrusts Collins.'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: "Not really, but that doesn't affect our work. As long as we can help the people on the surface, we'll do what it takes.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Karenina swings her transformable Blast Hammer, her weapon of choice, while Teddy watches from the side.'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: "So? It's cool, isn't it?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: 'Yeah. It suits you.', 4: '2'}
{3: 'Karenina was not expecting to hear Teddy complimenting her. She feels a little self-conscious.'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: 'Hmph... I designed it, after all. Not only does it pack a punch, but it can also adapt to different battles...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: "...A weapon that doesn't require careful maneuvers really fits a dumb*** who only knows how to hold the trigger down.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: 'Hey, are you interested in helping me test my weapon? I need a target, you little ****!', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Right as the two are about to strangle each other, a middle-aged man in researcher garb enters the preparation room. He looks very awkward, crouching as he comes in.'}
{1: '1', 2: '???', 3: "Ah, haha... Haha, eh, we actually have prepared something for you to test the new frame. You don't have to get your own target.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'The miserable-looking man is Yarha. He is said to be the research director of this lunar base, but his obsequious attitude appears otherwise.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Karenina', 3: 'Director Yarha, we were just kidding...', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Yarha', 3: 'Ah, haha... I was kidding too...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Right before the discomfort boils over, Teddy sighs and stands up from behind the calibration terminal.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Teddy', 3: 'Is the testing for the new frame about to begin? Can you take us there, Director Yarha?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Yarha', 3: 'Ah, correct. This way, please. But I really was kidding...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: 'Yeah, yeah, we know.', 4: '2'}
{3: 'The two of them follow Yarha, leaving the preparation room and heading toward the testing area. Meanwhile, two men quietly start talking on the other side of the room.'}

{1: '1', 2: 'Liszt', 3: 'Is that frame the "second request" from the girl? But why would you provide her with the frame we developed as the base model? We spent so much effort to reverse-engineer it from "her"...', 4: '1'}

{2: 'Collins', 3: 'Liszt, you\'re being silly now. "Don\'t be stingy with your baits if you want to catch a big fish." The fishermen in the Arctic told me that back when I was posted there. The more expensive the bait, the bigger the fish.', 4: '2'}
{3: 'Patting Liszt on the back, Collins starts walking toward the testing area, but he stops with some parting words before going further.'}
{2: 'Collins', 3: "Don't disregard ancient wisdom, you know?", 4: '2'}
{3: "Watching Collins' departing figure, Liszt tightens his tie."}
{2: 'Liszt', 3: "Of course... I'll remember that.", 4: '1'}
